title: Strange Freezes on MP4files
content:
Hello All,

I seem to have a problem with Firefox freezing. I moved back again to Firefox to maintain the adblockers that Chrome so graciously crippled.

Now, with that out of the way, I noticed that sites that have autoplaying mp4 files that basically act like good old-fashioned gifs tend to cause the firefox to freeze.

It is a strange freeze though - the whole browser becomes VISUALLY unresponsive, but if I click blindly, say to close the tab or if I scroll up or down it appears to work. How do I know? Well, if I drag the mouse to the bottom of the taskbar in Windows and bring up the thumbnail... It unfreezes the browser - showing the changes I made blindly, at least until it freezes again when the MP4 files start playing again.

The issue is not consistent either. Sometimes it goes through the mp4 files perfectly fine, but usually scrolling through any thread containing embedded MP4 videos, like reaction clips and the like, is literally impossible due to the rate of freezes.

I have narrowed down the culprit - the issues ceases when I disable the hardware acceleration, but I do not find it to be an acceptable solution in a long term - because disabling it causes various videos to play at noticeably lower and unpleasant framerates.

I'm fairly convinced it is NOT a hardware or software issue on my end - it is a brand new and powerful PC with a fresh install of Windows 11 and all the drivers are up to date, AMD GPU. Unless the issue is with some obscure codec, perhaps. However, the issue does not persist on any other browser I used.
creator: Hides

I tried Royalmail tracking on my mobile chrome and it works but does not work on Firefox.I have use Firefox for years and I thought there was something wrong with Royalmail tracking until I tried it on Chrome.Then it must be a Firefox problem. title: CSV file download not working in Firefox 139
content: Hi, can someone please help. I just updated Firefox this morning to version 139. Then went to a bank site to download a CSV file of transactions - something I've been doing for many years. I click the button to 'Export Activity (CSV)' and then a pop-up window comes asking me if I want to open or save the file. Another window opens, headed 'Enter name of file to save to' and shows me the folders and has boxes at the bottom 'File name' and 'Save as type'. Here is where the problem starts. The 'Save as type' box usually has CSV in it, but now it's greyed out. The only option there is 'All files'. So I have to select that, and after I press OK then another window comes up giving the folder path and filename and saying 'File not found, Check the filename and try again'. I also get a Windows Security message saying 'Unauthorised changes blocked, Controlled folder access blocked firefox.exe from making changes'. I should stress again that none of this has ever happened before so I suspect it must be related to the Firefox update. I was able to download from the same site on Microsoft Edge with no problems.

title: How to make the middle mouse button be a scroll toggle ONLY?
content:
I use the middle button only for toggling auto-scrolling on and off, or at least that's what I want to do.

That works, unless I mistakenly (often) click the button while over a hyperlinked image or link. In that case, the link opens in a new tab which disrupts my workflow.

How can I set up the mouse in FireFox so that clicking the middle button will ONLY toggle scrolling on and off and never open a link that may happen to be under the cursor?

I've been looking for a solution for this online for ages, and hope there is a setting for this. It's a frustration many times daily.

title: Prevent title bar from showing in macOS full-screen mode
content:
When using full-screen mode on macOS, moving the mouse to the top of the screen causes the title bar to appear. This frequently interferes with tab switching and leads to accidental clicks.

Is there any way to disable this automatic title bar reveal? Or, ideally, can it be made to behave like Safari, where only the window buttons slide down from the top-left without showing the entire title bar?

title: Firefox seems to freeze my PC when it needs an update.
content: Over the last month or two, my PC has frozen, not crashed, just frozen, while I was watching youtube. I have left it for a few hours, but it does not unfreeze. I am forced to hard restart the PC. When I restart Firefox, the first thing it does is update. It only happens when I have a Youtube video running, Youtube can be open in a tab but not running a video with no issue. Is it possible that the update request is locking up my PC? Is it being caused by Youtube? Any suggestions on how to stop it happening short of changing browsers? No error messages. No crash report. Nothing in the reports file to point me in the right direction.

title: Why Do You Hate Your Users?
content:
I have selected the option to update when I want. Why am I subjected to constant harassment? Every tab, every window, every EVERYTHING, I am asked if I want to update or dismiss. Please, for the LOVE OF ALL THAT IS HOLY, please stop.

You are literally making me dislike your otherwise very good product.
